1.2 — The Smithean View of Trade: Divison of Labor — Class Content

Meeting Date

Thursday, January 26, 2023

Overview

Today we look at Adam Smith’s understanding of what is the cause of the wealth of nations: the division of labor.

Readings

Recommended Reading

  • Smith (1776), Wealth of Nations, Book I, Chs. 1-3
  • Safner (2023), “It All Beings with the Division of Labor: Meditations on what should be the central insight of economics”
  • Safner (2023), “Division of Labor vs. the Invisible Hand: Two divergent trajectories of economic thought from two of its foundations”
  • Munger (2007), “I’ll Stick With These: Some Sharp Observations on the Division of Labor”
  • Bauer (2000), “From Subsistence to Exchange”
  • TED Talk: Thomas Thwaites: How I Built a Toaster From Scratch”
  • YouTube: How to Make a $1500 Sandwich in Only 6 Months”

Slides

Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides.

Tip

You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides.

I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (not everything is in the slides)!
